plentry.pd: Call duration (seconds) of the local user, cumulative.
Bytes sent.
Bytes received.
Audio bytes sent, cumulative.
Video bytes sent, cumulative.
Audio bytes received, cumulative.
Video bytes received, cumulative.
Sending bitrate (Kbps).
Receiving bitrate (Kbps).
Audio receiving bitrate (Kbps).
Audio sending bitrate (Kbps).
Video receiving bitrate (Kbps).
Video sending bitrate (Kbps).
Client-to-access server delay (ms).
Uplink packet loss rate (%) before applying anti-packet-loss technology.
Downlink packet loss rate (%) before applying anti-packet-loss technology.
Number of users in the current channel.

CPU usage (%) of the current App.
The cpuAppUsage reported in the callback is always 0.

CPU usage (%) of the current system. On Windows platforms with multi-core CPUs, this represents the average usage across all cores. Calculated as (100 - CPU usage of the System Idle Process shown in Task Manager)/100.
The cpuTotalUsage reported in the callback is always 0.
Time (ms) from starting to establish the connection to successful connection. A value of 0 indicates invalid.
Round-trip time (ms) from the client to the local router.
Memory usage ratio (%) of the current App. This value is for reference only. It may not be retrievable due to system limitations.
Memory usage ratio (%) of the current system. This value is for reference only. It may not be retrievable due to system limitations.
Memory usage (KB) of the current App. This value is for reference only. It may not be retrievable due to system limitations.
Call duration of the local user (seconds), cumulative value.
Number of bytes sent.
Number of bytes received.
Number of audio bytes sent, cumulative value.
Number of video bytes sent, cumulative value.
Number of audio bytes received, cumulative value.
Number of video bytes received, cumulative value.
Sending bitrate (Kbps).
Receiving bitrate (Kbps).
Audio receiving bitrate (Kbps).
Audio sending bitrate (Kbps).
Video receiving bitrate (Kbps).
Video sending bitrate (Kbps).
Client-to-access-server latency (ms).
Uplink packet loss rate (%) from client to server before anti-packet-loss technique is applied.
Downlink packet loss rate (%) from server to client before anti-packet-loss technique is applied.
Number of users in the current channel.

CPU usage (%) of the current app.
The cpuAppUsage reported in the callback is always 0.

CPU usage (%) of the current system.
The cpuTotalUsage reported in the callback is always 0.
Since Android 8.1, due to system limitations, you cannot obtain CPU usage through this property.
Time from starting connection to successful connection (ms). A value of 0 indicates invalid.

Round-trip time (ms) from client to local router. This property is enabled by default on devices before iOS 14 and disabled on iOS 14 and later.
To enable this property on iOS 14 and later, [contact technical support](https://ticket.shengwang.cn/). On Android, to obtain gatewayRtt, ensure that the android.permission.ACCESS_WIFI_STATE permission is added after </application> in your project's AndroidManifest.xml file.
Memory usage ratio (%) of the current app. This value is for reference only. It may not be available due to system limitations.
Memory usage ratio (%) of the current system. This value is for reference only. It may not be available due to system limitations.
Memory usage (KB) of the current app. This value is for reference only. It may not be available due to system limitations.
Call duration of the local user (seconds), cumulative value.
Bytes sent.
Bytes received.
Audio bytes sent, cumulative value.
Video bytes sent, cumulative value.
Audio bytes received, cumulative value.
Video bytes received, cumulative value.
Sending bitrate (Kbps).
Receiving bitrate (Kbps).
Audio receiving bitrate (Kbps).
Audio packet sending bitrate (Kbps).
Video receiving bitrate (Kbps).
Video sending bitrate (Kbps).
Client-to-access-server latency (milliseconds).
Uplink packet loss rate (%) from client to server before applying anti-packet-loss technology.
Downlink packet loss rate (%) from server to client before applying anti-packet-loss technology.
Number of users in the current channel.

CPU usage (%) of the current app.
The cpuAppUsage reported in the callback is always 0.
Starting from Android 8.1, due to system limitations, you may not be able to obtain CPU usage via this property.

CPU usage (%) of the current system. For Windows platform, in multi-core environments, this member indicates the average usage of multi-core CPUs. The calculation is (100 - CPU usage of system idle process shown in Task Manager)/100.
The cpuTotalUsage reported in the callback is always 0.
Time from starting to establish connection to successful connection (milliseconds). A value of 0 indicates invalid.

Round-trip time from client to local router (ms). This property is enabled by default on devices running iOS versions earlier than 14, and disabled on iOS 14 and later.
To enable this property on iOS 14 and later, please [contact technical support](https://ticket.shengwang.cn/). On Android, to obtain gatewayRtt, make sure you have added the android.permission.ACCESS_WIFI_STATE permission after </application> in your project's AndroidManifest.xml file.
Memory usage ratio (%) of the current app. This value is for reference only. It may not be retrievable due to system limitations.
Memory usage ratio (%) of the current system. This value is for reference only. It may not be retrievable due to system limitations.
Memory usage of the current app (KB). This value is for reference only. It may not be retrievable due to system limitations.
Call duration of the local user (seconds), cumulative value.
Bytes sent.
Bytes received.
Audio bytes sent, cumulative value.
Video bytes sent, cumulative value.
Audio bytes received, cumulative value.
Video bytes received, cumulative value.
Sending bitrate (Kbps).
Receiving bitrate (Kbps).
Audio receiving bitrate (Kbps).
Audio packet sending bitrate (Kbps).
Video receiving bitrate (Kbps).
Video sending bitrate (Kbps).
Client-to-access-server latency (ms).
Uplink packet loss rate (%) from client to server before anti-packet-loss technology is applied.
Downlink packet loss rate (%) from server to client before anti-packet-loss technology is applied.
Number of users in the current channel.

CPU usage of the current app (%).
The cpuAppUsage reported in the callback is always 0.
Starting from Android 8.1, due to system restrictions, you may not be able to obtain CPU usage through this property.

CPU usage of the current system (%). On Windows, in a multi-core environment, this member represents the average usage of multi-core CPUs. It is calculated as (100 - CPU usage of system idle process shown in Task Manager)/100.
The cpuTotalUsage reported in the callback is always 0.
Starting from Android 8.1, due to system restrictions, you cannot obtain CPU usage through this property.
Time from connection initiation to successful connection (ms). A value of 0 indicates invalid.

Round-trip latency from client to local router (ms). This property is enabled by default on devices running iOS versions earlier than 14 and disabled on iOS 14 and later.
To enable this property on devices running iOS 14 and later, please [contact technical support](https://ticket.shengwang.cn/). On Android, to retrieve gatewayRtt, make sure to add the android.permission.ACCESS_WIFI_STATE permission after the </application> tag in your project's AndroidManifest.xml file.
Memory usage ratio of the current app (%). This value is for reference only. It may not be available due to system limitations.
Memory usage ratio of the current system (%). This value is for reference only. It may not be available due to system limitations.
Memory size of the current app (KB). This value is for reference only. It may not be available due to system limitations.
